item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：美国消费者监督机构就 Zelle 骗局对美国各大银行进行调查
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三报道，美国消费者金融保护局（CFPB）正在调查美国各大银行对点对点支付平台 Zelle 上客户资金的处理情况。【原文：The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) is investigating major U.S. banks for their handling of customer funds on the peer-to-peer payments platform Zelle, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: Equity Residential 将以近 10 亿美元从 Blackstone 收购公寓投资组合
item.description: Equity Residential 已同意以约 9.64 亿美元的价格从 Blackstone 收购 11 处公寓物业。【原文：Equity Residential has agreed to acquire 11 apartment properties from Blackstone for about $964 million, the companies said on Wednesday.】

item.title: Instacart 因强劲的食品配送需求和广告业务增长而股价大涨
item.description: Instacart 股价在周三的盘前交易中上涨超过 10%，原因是杂货配送需求强劲，广告业务也出现了可喜的增长迹象，这有助于该公司预测本季度业绩向好。【原文：Shares of Instacart rose more than 10% in premarket trading on Wednesday as strong demand for grocery delivery and promising signs of growth in its advertising business helped the company forecast an upbeat current quarter.】

item.title: 诺和诺德公司称，美国患者服用伟哥维肥胖症药物 "约六个月
item.description: 诺和诺德公司的一位高管周三表示，美国患者服用该公司生产的Wegovy减肥药的时间 "约为6个月"。【原文：U.S. patients are staying on Novo Nordisk's Wegovy weight-loss medication for "around six months", an executive said on Wednesday, adding that the company is confident that over time as shortages ease that will increase to 12 months.】

item.title: 拉尔夫-劳伦（Ralph Lauren）盈利超预期，因欧洲和中国需求稳定
item.description: 拉尔夫-劳伦公司（Ralph Lauren Corp）第一季度利润超出预期，原因是欧洲和中国市场对其价格昂贵的牛仔裤和马球衫的稳定需求抵消了美国市场销售的放缓，使其股价在周三盘前上涨了 4%。【原文：Ralph Lauren Corp beat first-quarter profit estimates as steady demand for its pricey denims and polo shirts in Europe and China offset slower sales in the U.S., sending its shares up 4% premarket on Wednesday.】

item.title: Emerson 因测量仪器需求增长而实现季度盈利
item.description: 艾默生电气周三公布的第三季度财报显示，该公司生产阀门、调节器和执行器的部门第三季度盈利增加，主要得益于市场对这些产品的需求。【原文：Emerson Electric reported higher third-quarter earnings on Wednesday, aided by demand for its unit which makes valves, regulators and actuators.】

item.title: 医疗器械需求强劲，Zimmer Biomet 盈利超出预期
item.description: Zimmer Biomet 控股公司周三公布的第二季度利润超出华尔街预期，原因是市场对其用于关节重建手术的设备需求强劲。【原文：Zimmer Biomet Holdings beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit on Wednesday, driven by robust demand for its devices used in joint reconstruction procedures.】

item.title: 美国汽车监管机构对超过 77,000 辆日产 SUV 展开调查
item.description: 美国汽车安全监管机构周三表示，已开始对77,131辆日产汽车的转向拉杆问题进行初步评估。【原文：U.S. auto safety regulator has opened a preliminary evaluation into 77,131 Nissan vehicles over reports of an issue with the steering tie rod, it said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 预测疲软预示旅游需求放缓，Airbnb 股价暴跌
item.description: Airbnb 周三在盘前交易中股价暴跌近 16%，此前这家在线旅游公司预计第三季度营收低于预期，理由是美国需求放缓和预订窗口缩短。【原文：Shares of Airbnb slumped nearly 16% in premarket trading on Wednesday after the online travel company forecast third-quarter revenue below estimates, citing slowing demand in the United States and shorter booking windows.】

item.title: 纽约时报》第二季度订阅收入超出预期
item.description: 纽约时报》周三公布的第二季度订阅收入超出华尔街预期，主要得益于捆绑内容产品的强劲需求。【原文：The New York Times beat Wall Street expectations for second-quarter subscription revenue on Wednesday, helped by robust demand for its bundled content offerings.】

item.title: 由于人工智能的推动，Shopify 季度收入超出预期
item.description: 本周三，Shopify 的季度营收超过了分析师的预期，因为这家加拿大公司的人工智能工具帮助其电子商务服务吸引了更多的商家，使其美股在盘前交易中上涨了 15%。【原文：Shopify beat analysts' estimates for quarterly revenue on Wednesday, as the Canadian company's artificial intelligence-powered tools helped pull in more merchants to its e-commerce services, sending its U.S. shares up 15% in premarket trading.】

item.title: 据《日经新闻》报道，KKR 将以 40 亿美元的管理层收购帮助富士软实现私有化
item.description: 据《日经商业日报》周三报道，美国私募股权公司 KKR & Co 计划帮助日本系统开发商富士软公司通过管理层收购实现私有化，收购价值约为 6000 亿日元（40.9 亿美元）。【原文：U.S. private equity firm KKR & Co plans to help Japanese system developer Fuji Soft go private under a management buyout worth about 600 billion yen ($4.09 billion), the Nikkei business daily reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 独家报道：美国环保局称正在对生物燃料生产商的废食用油供应进行审计
item.description: 美国环保署已对至少两家可再生燃料生产商的供应链展开调查，因为业界担心其中一些生产商可能会使用虚假的生物柴油原料来获取利润丰厚的政府补贴。【原文：The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency has launched investigations into the supply chains of at least two renewable fuel producers amid industry concerns that some may be using fraudulent feedstocks for biodiesel to secure lucrative government subsidies.】

item.title: 美国 30 年期抵押贷款利率因就业数据疲软和美联储降息信号而下降
item.description: 在美联储发出可能在 9 月份开始下调政策利率的信号后，美国最受欢迎的住房贷款利率上周骤降至 15 个月以来的最低水平，而就业市场的下行支撑了金融市场对大幅下调政策利率的押注。【原文：The interest rate for the most popular U.S. home loan plunged last week to its lowest level in 15 months, after the Federal Reserve signaled it could start cutting its policy rate in September, and a downshift in the job market bolstered financial market bets the cuts would be big.】

item.title: 洞察：芯片巨头英特尔如何唾弃 OpenAI 并落后于时代
item.description: 对于美国芯片巨头英特尔（Intel）来说，在人工智能时代陷入困境之前，它曾是计算机时代的宠儿。【原文：For U.S. chip giant Intel, the darling of the computer age before it fell on harder times in the AI era, things might have been quite different.】

item.title: 华特迪士尼盈利超出市场预期；乐园利润下滑
item.description: 华特迪士尼周三公布的季度财报超出华尔街预期，这主要得益于皮克斯动画电影《Inside Out 2》的成功，该片帮助迪士尼克服了主题公园利润下滑的问题。【原文：Walt Disney reported on Wednesday quarterly earnings that exceeded Wall Street expectations, buoyed by the success of animated Pixar film "Inside Out 2", which helped overcome a profit decline at theme parks.】

item.title: 医疗成本上升，CVS Health 下调 2024 年利润预期
item.description: CVS Health Corp 周三下调了 2024 年的利润预期，原因是医疗保健服务需求持续上升，导致其医疗保险部门的医疗成本增加。【原文：CVS Health Corp on Wednesday cut its 2024 profit forecast, hit by increased medical costs at its health insurance unit as demand for healthcare services remained elevated.】

item.title: 比利时 imec 利用 ASML 新型芯片印刷机取得突破性进展
item.description: 比利时的 imec 公司是世界顶级半导体研发公司之一，该公司周三报告说，它与 ASML 公司共同运营的联合实验室在计算机芯片制造方面取得了多项突破，该实验室使用的是荷兰公司最新推出的耗资 3.5 亿欧元（3.82 亿美元）的芯片打印设备。【原文：Belgium's imec, one of the world's top semiconductor R&D firms, on Wednesday reported several computer chip-making breakthroughs at a joint laboratory it operates with ASML , using the Dutch company's newest 350 million euro ($382 million) chip printing machine.】

item.title: 大型科技公司延续复苏势头，期货反弹
item.description: 美国股指期货周三跳涨，原因是风险偏好在本周早些时候大幅下挫后有所恢复，一位有影响力的日本央行决策者对加息的谨慎评论也提振了市场情绪。【原文：U.S. stock index futures jumped on Wednesday as risk appetite returned after a steep selloff earlier in the week, with sentiment also getting a boost from cautious comments on interest-rate hikes by an influential Bank of Japan policymaker.】

item.title: 希尔顿因国际旅游需求上调 2024 年利润预期
item.description: 希尔顿全球酒店集团（Hilton Worldwide）周三上调了 2024 年的利润预期，认为国际旅游需求将保持强劲，并能抵消美国国内旅游正常化带来的损失。【原文：Hotel operator Hilton Worldwide raised its forecast for 2024 profit on Wednesday, banking on international travel demand to remain strong and offset losses from normalizing domestic travel in the U.S.】

item.title: 美国 日本央行缓解市场偏头痛，超微疼痛
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 聚焦：玛氏酝酿收购 Kellanova 的交易应经得起监管审查
item.description: 法律专家说，玛氏公司对美国零食制造商 Kellanova 的收购计划很有可能通过全球反垄断监管机构的审查，尽管这涉及到政府监督的一个敏感领域--消费者为食品支付多少钱。【原文：Mars' contemplated acquisition of U.S. snack maker Kellanova stands a good chance of getting past global antitrust regulators, legal experts say, even as it touches on a sensitive area of government oversight -- how much consumers pay for food.】

item.title: 运力过剩损害价格，加航利润下降
item.description: 加拿大航空公司周三公布的第二季度利润下降，原因是某些市场的运力过剩和国际航线的激烈竞争削弱了其定价能力。【原文：Air Canada reported a lower second-quarter profit on Wednesday, as excess capacity in certain markets and stiff competition on international routes hurt its pricing power.】

item.title: 沃尔兹领导下的明尼苏达州经济五张图
item.description: 接替美国总统乔-拜登的民主党提名人、副总统卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）已选定明尼苏达州州长蒂姆-瓦尔兹（Tim Walz）作为她在 11 月 5 日大选中的竞选搭档。【原文：Vice President Kamala Harris, the Democratic nominee to succeed U.S. President Joe Biden, has selected Minnesota Governor Tim Walz, a champion of progressive economic policies such as universal school meals, to be her running mate in the Nov. 5 election.】

item.title: 聚焦亚马逊 Prime Video 计划进军好莱坞
item.description: 当迈克-霍普金斯（Mike Hopkins）接到领导亚马逊 Prime Video 的邀请时，他对流媒体服务的看法与好莱坞的普遍看法不谋而合--这不过是在线零售商两日送达服务用户的一项福利而已。【原文：When Mike Hopkins was approached about leading Amazon Prime Video, his view of the streaming service matched one held widely in Hollywood -- it was nothing more than a perk for subscribers of the online retailer’s two-day delivery service.】

item.title: 美国安全委员会将审查联邦航空局对波音公司的监督
item.description: 美国国家运输安全委员会（NTSB）周三计划审查对波音公司的监督情况，因为今年 1 月发生的 737 MAX 9 空中紧急情况引发了严重的安全问题。【原文：The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) on Wednesday plans to review oversight of Boeing after a 737 MAX 9 mid-air emergency in January raised serious safety questions.】

item.title: Lyft 第二季度首次实现净利润
item.description: Lyft 周三公布的第二季度营收好于预期，并首次实现净利润，这主要得益于去年乘车共享市场的蓬勃发展和公司范围内的成本削减。【原文：Lyft reported better-than-expected revenue in the second quarter and posted a net profit for the first time on Wednesday, driven by a booming ride-share market and company-wide cost cuts last year.】

item.title: 利润率和盈利预测令人失望，超微公司业绩下滑
item.description: 超微计算机公司（Super Micro Computer）股价在周三的盘前交易中暴跌 12.3%，原因是对人工智能服务器芯片生产成本高企的担忧影响了该公司的利润预期，使其乐观的销售预期大打折扣。【原文：Super Micro Computer shares tumbled 12.3% in premarket trading on Wednesday as concerns over the high cost of producing AI server chips weighing on its profit forecast, eclipsing upbeat sales forecasts.】

item.title: 解说：什么是日元套利交易？
item.description: 全球股市和债券市场，尤其是日本股市和债券市场，正受到大受欢迎的日元套利交易平仓的冲击。【原文：Global stock and bond markets, in particular Japan's, are being rocked by an unwinding of the hugely popular yen carry trade.】

item.title: 机场首席执行官称，ITA 与汉莎航空的交易可能有助于罗马的长途旅行和商务旅行
item.description: 罗马菲乌米奇诺机场首席执行官告诉路透社，在汉莎航空获得欧盟批准收购 ITA 航空公司股份后，该机场作为长途航班和商务客运枢纽仍有发展空间。【原文：Rome Fiumicino airport sees room to grow as a hub for long-haul flights and business passengers after Lufthansa won European Union approval to buy a stake in ITA Airways, its CEO told Reuters.】
